title: Are all neutrinos the same? - Quora

response.answer_text: They come in three types. (The term “flavor” is often used. During the 1960’s, physicists used terms for humorous effect. “Flavor”, “color”, etc.) Each is a partner to a different charged lepton. (A charged lepton is an electron, or another particle just like an electron but much more massive.) So we have the electron’s neutrino, the muon’s neutrino, and the tau’s neutrino.
